case.name: United Insurance Advisers Pty Ltd v United Insurance Advisers (National) Pty Ltd [2006] FCA 440 (14 March 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: application that respondent's costs of certain issues be paid on indemnity basis
award on solicitor and client' or indemnity' basis
departure from general rule in federal court rules order 62 r 3(3)
costs to be paid forthwith. orders
stay of orders for taxation and payment of costs pending disposition of application for leave to appeal and any appeal.

citances.sentence:
11 Reliance is also placed upon the decision in United Insurance Advisers Pty Ltd v United Insurance Advisers (National) Pty Ltd [2006] FCA 440 per Young J at [28] where his Honour said:
'The essential principle is that a discretion can be exercised to order costs on an indemnity basis where the actions of the unsuccessful party have been unreasonable or high-handed or where the claim in question was totally frivolous or hopeless or fundamentally flawed. '
